utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m telling you. Something happened. Something changed. It’s been weird between us lately.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Lately? Kate, it’s been weird for 4 years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, this is different. He’s different. It’s like he’s pulling away.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, can you blame him? He’s probably tired of waiting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Waiting? Waiting for what?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What do you think? The guy is crazy about you. And despite your little act, you’re crazy about him. Oh, what? Was that supposed to be some big secret?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. No. Do you think he knows?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Do you remember how he used to be? Girl on either arm? You really don’t see that guy too much anymore. Why do you think that is? He’s waiting for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but Lanie –

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I know. You’re dealing with stuff. But you cannot ask him to wait forever. Unless, of course, you’re okay with him pulling away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What if it doesn’t work? What if it ends up like you and Javi?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well at least we gave it a shot. And so it didn’t work out. So what? Now we can move on, give or take the occasional booty call.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I just – I don’t want to lose what we have, you know?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Girl, please. What exactly do you have, really?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A friendship.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No. What you and I have is a friendship. What you and Castle have is a holding pattern. How long can you circle before the fuel runs out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Don’t think you were saved by the bell, Kate Beckett. As your friend, I’m not going to let drop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, what? You think I should tell him how I feel?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yes! You hunt murderers for a living. You can do this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. I just, I – I have to find the right time.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No time like the present.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What the… ?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: On second thought, maybe you should wait a bit. What’s that? Ryan’s calling? I – gotta go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll call you in about an hour.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I feel like I just walked into a bad episode of Miami Vice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, first, there are no bad episodes of Miami Vice. Second, who died?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You, from the looks of it. You look like you just got run over by a truck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, a truck delivering a shipment of awesome. Nah, I just uh, flew into Vegas for the weekend. Just needed a little change of scenery.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you won the blonde in a high stakes poker match?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I met her on the flight back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you just gave her your car?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jacinda happens to be a very trustworthy person. She’s a first class flight attendant. It’s not like I gave her my social security number.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle – is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Never better.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Our victim’s Naomi Allen, age 25. Her green card indicates she’s a British national. Ryan’s notifying the consulate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Her address is in SoHo. What was she doing all the way down here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t know, but she checked in 2 hours before she was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hope they prorated the room.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Good news is we have a witness. The maid who discovered the body saw a guy run out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did the maid get a good look?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s with the sketch artist now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then whoever he is he was looking for something. This place has been searched.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: One thing we do know is that she was not robbed. Her wallet, watch, and cash were untouched.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Lanie, how does it look?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Like you waited too long.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The vic.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: She was strangled, but she went down with a fight. Prelim suggests signs of a struggle. She took one to the face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A well dressed, attractive woman in a seedy motel and a guy who flees the crime scene. This might have been a one night stand gone wrong.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Are we talking about the victim or Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Espo?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you contact the next of kin and canvass the area once the sketch is done?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, no problem.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Found the vic’s business card in the side pocket of her purse. Looks like she works in Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Naomi Allen, Kittman Group.

utterance.speaker: CLAIRE PANCHARD
utterance.content: Yes, I was her US booking agent. Naomi was one of our top models.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she was in the city for work?

utterance.speaker: CLAIRE
utterance.content: She split her time between here and London. The good ones usually end up spending half the year in New York.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now do you have any idea why she was at the Alexandria Motel last night?

utterance.speaker: CLAIRE
utterance.content: Uh, no. I’ve never even heard of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s one of those … um… pay by the hour places.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: CLAIRE
utterance.content: No. No I don’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you do have an idea of who he might be.

utterance.speaker: CLAIRE
utterance.content: It’s just … lately Naomi was making some choices.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of choices?

utterance.speaker: CLAIRE
utterance.content: Well, she seemed to have lost interest in standard modeling jobs. Recently she had been booking more uh … unconventional gigs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: CLAIRE
utterance.content: Well I heard the London office booked her to attend the birthday party of some foreign dignitary a few months ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was hired to go to a party?

utterance.speaker: CLAIRE
utterance.content: It’s common for models to get hired to pretty up an event. Some girls do it to pick up extra cash and other girls do it as a way of connecting with wealthy men.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, are you saying Naomi was hiring herself out as an escort?

utterance.speaker: CLAIRE
utterance.content: You just don’t see girls good as Naomi taking these party jobs. Not unless there’s a bigger payout involved somewhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know if she took on any of these kinds of gigs recently?

utterance.speaker: CLAIRE
utterance.content: It’s not really what we do. She did want me to try to get her into an event last night, though. An album launch party in Midtown. But I didn’t have any connections to it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Last night?

utterance.speaker: CLAIRE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you thinking what I’m thinking?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, that we should throw a party and hire a bunch of models.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. That maybe Naomi somehow got into that party last night and that that’s where she met her killer. That’s what I was thinking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Weird. We’re usually more in sync than that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Ryan, did you find anything at Naomi’s apartment?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but someone else might have. It’s been tossed. Not only that, but the neighbor said they saw a man leaving the apartment late last night. The neighbor ID’d him off the sketch. It’s the same guy who fled the murder scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He couldn’t find what he was looking for in the motel so he searched her place.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but this time he left a footprint.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Meaning?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, unis canvassed around the apartment with the sketch. He bought a bottle of single malt with a credit card a couple of blocks away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Colin Hunt. What do we have on him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nothing in the system but I ran a trace on the credit card. He checked in to the Mondaray in SoHo this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD! Show me your hands.

utterance.speaker: COLIN HUNT
utterance.content: You’re making a mistake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, like I haven’t heard that before. Hands in the air, now.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: If you insist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa! Dude. Whoa.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Allow me to introduce myself. Detective Inspector Colin Hunt, Scotland Yard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re a long way from home, Detective Inspector Hunt. How did you end up in that dead girl’s hotel room?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: I was at a seminar last night in DC when Naomi called me, panicked. She said she was in trouble and needed my help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you knew her?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Naomi was like a sister to me. Her dad, Terrence, was my first partner on the job. When he passed away I promised her family I’d look after her. After she called me I grabbed the next flight but by the time I arrived it was too late.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And your first instinct was to flee the crime scene?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: I didn’t flee. I left. She was dead. There was nothing else to do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Except to maybe hang around and give the police a statement.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: You and I both know that if I had stuck around it would be hours of questioning and then you’d send me off with a “cheers, we’ll keep you posted”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But I suppose you had something more important to do?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: The room had been searched. And whoever killed her was looking for something. I thought they might try her apartment next. By the time I got there it had already been tossed. Look, I know I shouldn’t have been investigating. But if you were in a foreign country and someone you loved was killed what would you do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What were they looking for?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: When he was on the job, Naomi’s dad used to stash a gun in the lining of his Kevlar. When Naomi started modeling as a teenager he didn’t want her on the underground without any protection so he taught her to cut a tiny piece of lining in her jacket to stash pepper spray. That’s where I found it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You found what?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: A message to me. About her killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of message?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Not until I’m on the case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Detective, please. I owe this to Naomi. I owe it to her family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You do realize that I could arrest you for withholding evidence.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: And since you don’t know what that evidence is, I could deny it. And none of that will get us any closer to catching her killer. Let me work this care with you. Because if you don’t I swear, I’ll go out there and catch the bastard on my own.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. But I have to check in with my Captain first.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: What’s she like, your Captain?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You ever see that YouTube video of the grizzly bear that decapitates a moose with one swipe of its paw?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Comforting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s nothing personal. She just doesn’t like outsiders in her precinct.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: I don’t need her to like it. I just need her to allow it. This whole thing with Naomi doesn’t add up. Turning down conventional modeling jobs, booking sleazy jobs at private parties, that just doesn’t sound like the Naomi I know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah well, sometimes it’s the people we think we know best that we really don’t know at all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well… you’re in.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Seriously?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, your supervisor at Scotland Yard said you’re one of the best. Even Captain Gates was impressed with your record.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well I guess it’s not outsiders she doesn’t like. It’s just me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, we had a deal. What did Naomi give you?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: This.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A key? You said she left a message.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: This is the message. She put it there for me to find. I guarantee it has something to do with her death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This looks commercial.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: It’s an Arco-Rifkin 1130R. Mostly used for lockers found at train stations or health clubs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Well, I’ll have Ryan canvass the area around her apartment and the hotel. We’ll see if any of the businesses have lockers that use this kind of key.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett, I got something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey uh, Detective Esposito, this is Detective Inspector Colin Hunt. He’s from Scotland Yard. He’s going to be consulting on this case. He knows our victim.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, how’s it going?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Pleasure, mate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, what do you got?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, Naomi did make it to that album release party last night at a club in Midtown. But she was kicked out by security around 10 o’clock.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She had an altercation with the host. Female rapper and ex-felon Nicki J. And she wasn’t afraid to take a swing in front of paparazzi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. What was the fight about?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Unclear, but uniforms are bringing her up to interrogation now.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Do you usually question them solo?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle and I usually go in together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, you know what? Why don’t you guys take this one?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Absolutely. Besides, Colin’s got a personal interest. I really don’t, now do I?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Hah, all right. It’s settled then.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess it is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Besides, my lunch date is here. I’ll be back in a few hours. You guys call me if you find anything interesting.

utterance.speaker: NICKI J
utterance.content: Hell yeah I clocked it. She was trying to make a move on my man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your man Biggie Slim?

utterance.speaker: NICKI J
utterance.content: That’s right. She had the nerve to say that he told her to put her digits in his phone.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Did he?

utterance.speaker: NICKI J
utterance.content: That ain’t the point. That skinny b*tch wasn’t even supposed to be there. When I got up in her face she said that Biggie Slim’s cousin Drew told her about the party. But I knew that was BS because Drew wasn’t even invited.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Must make you so bloody mad to know that your man has a wandering eye. I had a girlfriend like that. Traveled for business. She’d ring from the airport to say that her flight was cancelled. I come to find out that she was seeing some other bloke.

utterance.speaker: NICKI J
utterance.content: She sound like a ho.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: I’ll I’m saying is, I understand your instinct to lash out at the person you believe is responsible.

utterance.speaker: NICKI J
utterance.content: I protect what’s mine. You should do the same.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that why you followed Naomi to the motel and strangled her with your bare hands?

utterance.speaker: NICKI J
utterance.content: You must be high. That skank wasn’t worth another second of my time. I told security to give her the boot and that was that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Can you prove it?

utterance.speaker: NICKI J
utterance.content: My driver brought us home. I was with Biggie Slim the rest of the night.

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: Yeah, I went home with Nicki J. After the tussle she was all worked up. But I like it when she gets worked up. When she got something to prove.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She said that the fight started because you were spending time with this girl.

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: Oh yeah, that girl. What can I say? Women are powerless to my good looks and charm.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Yes, it’s a curse. You and Naomi, what did you talk about?

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: Ah, a little bit of this, a little bit of that. She wasn’t a bad chick. But a little off, you know what I’m talking about?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: No, what are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: She was acting paranoid, man. Said someone had followed her to the party. Figured she was just blowing smoke.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Why’s that?

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: Look, I just don’t produce Nicki J, all right? I’m building my brand. I got Biggie Slim Records, Biggie Slim clothing. Hell, I even got a Biggie Slim energy drink. So some filly comes up trying to make her time? It’s just an everyday thing in my life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she tell you who she thought was following her?

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: Sure didn’t. I guess she wasn’t lying though, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Naomi left that party and then 3 hours later she was dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Based on what she told Biggie Slim, Naomi knew someone was after her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let’s canvass the area around the party venue. See if she was being followed. And let’s track down Nicki J and Biggie Slim’s driver. I want to see if they went straight home.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: On it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So… that story you told Nicki J about your girlfriend…

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Total pants. I just wanted her to think I sympathized and, honestly, after meeting Biggie Slim I do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, maybe she’s hanging on hoping that he’ll change.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Guys like him never do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our ME’s finished the autopsy.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Her larynx was crushed. Whoever did it was strong. Large hands. Probably a male.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s like half the city.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You may be able to narrow it down a little further than that. The pressure from the killer’s grip left a print on her neck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you able to pull a print?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: We were able to pull a partial thanks to the body lotion she was wearing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it in the system?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not enough to run if, but you bring me a print from a suspect and I can tell you if it’s a match.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Excuse me, I have to make a call.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Easy on the eyes. Cute accent, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I just got one question.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Where’s Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He took off. For a lunch date.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: In a Ferrari full of flight attendant?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s probably trying to rack up his frequent flyer miles.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m sorry. But you know she’s just a passing thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do I? I mean, the guy has been divorced twice and he’s still chasing bimbos. Maybe that’s just who he is.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Look, maybe’s it’s the wrong time. Or maybe he’s even the wrong guy. But if he is, how long are you going to wait to find out?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Ten years I’ve been keeping them company while they spend a night or two here on their way to where we’re all going. They all had plans, Kate. Things they were going to do when they got around to it. Go on a cruise, lose 10 pounds, fall in love. They thought they had all the time in the world. But nobody does.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Personal ones are tough. No call.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: What’s my tell?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The brooding lean.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Ah, yes. Rookie move. You know, even with a mouth full of braces she was the prettiest girl in her class. Although having a cop for a dad didn’t do much for her social life. Terry used to interrogate her dates when they used to drop her off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I could see how that would weed out the lightweights.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: And when she was 22 she fell in love with a young doctor. Good guy. He died last year in Africa doing God’s work. I don’t think she ever really got over it because hearing what she was up to … it’s like she was a different person.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: People change when you’re not looking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Hey Ryan, what’s up? Are you sure? Where? Okay, great. Call in a warrant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Found a gym near the hotel. Naomi bought a day pass there the night that she was killed and the clerk said she was in and out in 3 minutes.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Just enough time to run in and hide something in one of their lockers.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She bought the day pass at 10:24PM.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: That’s 20 minutes after she called me to say that she was in trouble.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: She was leaving me a message.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She did better than leave a message about the killer. She left us a picture of him as well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything on the number sequence?

utterance.speaker: TECH GUY
utterance.content: We’re running it through every database but nothing so far.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: She wrote it on there for a reason.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the photo?

utterance.speaker: TECH GUY
utterance.content: Well ,based on the light and background architecture, this photo was taken in Midtown New York.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. What’d I miss?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, not much. Oh, we did manage to find the mystery locker. And that guy in the photo, he’s probably our killer. So, how was your lunch?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I loved the special.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll bet.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Can you blow up this one section?

utterance.speaker: TECH GUY
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rounded and gold? It’s a plaque.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: It’s the British seal. This picture was taken right outside the British Consulate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pull up a list of the Consulate employees.

utterance.speaker: TECH GUY
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Well he’s not on this page.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There he is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nigel Wyndham.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Deputy general of the British Consulate.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Which means he’s just under the Consulate General in rank so he’s responsible for the daily operations in financial and logistical matters.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell was Naomi doing mixed up with this guy?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: That was my mate at Scotland Yard. He found out some intriguing details on Nigel Wyndham. Like the fact that a girlfriend in college died rather mysteriously while they were on holiday in Rome.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well was he ever charged?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Nope. And after that he had a string of bad investments until he married Cynthia Woodlow. It was her prominent family that pulled strings and got him a position, first at the Ministry of Culture and then here at the Consulate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. So we’ve been reconstructing Naomi’s movements since she landed in New York a couple of weeks ago. Her financials indicate that she booked a car service last week that dropped her at Nobu. Now we showed the host Nigel’s picture and he confirmed that they met for dinner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did the host notice anything?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, he noticed the c-note Nigel dropped to secure the romantic table in the back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. I just called the Consulate. The day after the romantic Nobu dinner security removed Naomi from Nigel’s office.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well it sounds like a fight.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, security heard Naomi yell something about Cynthia as they escorted her out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it makes perfect sense. Stuck in a marriage of convenience, Nigel meets the young and beautiful Naomi, finds her irresistible. A chance meeting turns to dinner, dinner to a tryst but then Naomi wants more. Nigel realizes that his affair has become a threat to his position, to his reputation, to the life he built on the backs of his wife and her family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, if Nigel’s wife found out about an affair it would kill his marriage and his career.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective Inspector Hunt, I take it by your silence that you don’t agree?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Well, the Naomi I knew would never fall for someone like Wyndham, but she wouldn’t have left his picture in that locker if he weren’t connected to her death somehow.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Nigel Wyndham’s position at the Consulate includes diplomatic immunity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which would be waived if he were a suspect in a murder case.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: If I pick up the phone to make that request I’m going to need something more concrete than just a theory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, Lanie pulled our killer’s prints off of our victim’s neck. And given everything that we know right now, I’m willing to bet that they’re a match to Nigel’s.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: A bet’s not enough. But if you can get those prints then this is a whole different conversation.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Here’s the problem, bro. Foreign dignitaries don’t register their fingerprints with local law enforcement.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And if we put in a request to the Consulate they’ll box us out and alert Nigel that he’s a suspect.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I thought Scotland Yard would be able to get them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Even with his connections across the pond we struck out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, boys. Here it is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here’s what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My foolproof plan for getting Nigel’s fingerprint. Nigel lives in a high rise apartment here on Park Avenue.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, high security.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. Ryan, you’ll be here. Front door, dressed as a flower delivery boy. Esposito, you’ll be here dressed as a hobo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Question. Why does the brown man gotta be the hobo?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You want the flowers?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hobo it is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You boys will cause a distraction whilst I rappel down the side of the building with Nicolai.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who’s Nicolai?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s a Romanian gymnast I found on YouTube. He’s extremely flexible and fits in the duffel bag. Using a glass cutter –

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Excuse me, gents. Has anyone seen Detective Beckett?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wow. Uh… you guys going out?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: I pulled some strings and got us into a party at the British Consulate tonight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nigel will be there. We’ll get his prints and he won’t even know it.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Cheers lads.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or they could do that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, if you want to do it the easy way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So who is Sir Alfred Heath?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Tonight, I am. The lads back home said the real Sir Alfred is down as a no-show. Gout or some damned thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but what if Nigel Wyndham doesn’t show, either?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: He’ll be here. And I expect he’ll skip the champagne and drink something posh and pretentious and leave his print on the glass.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What if he doesn’t drink?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: He’s British. Trust me, he drinks.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: May I?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn’t realize that dancing was part of the plan.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Oh … well. It offers the perfect vantage point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you come to a lot of these events?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: No, thank God. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You just seem very … confident.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Ah. Well, that’s because my companion is the most beautiful woman in this room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s clearly the champagne talking. I’m sure your just comfortable here because you’re amongst your own people.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: These aren’t my people. My people are the ones carrying the trays. Yeah. I grew up in the East End. My mum cleaned flats, dad worked in a factory. They wanted something better, they just – couldn’t quite get it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: I was admitted to Eton on scholarship where I minored in blending in. What about you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I grew up in the city and went to college in California.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Well, you could obviously do anything you put your mind to. Why be a cop?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I guess it was just my calling.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Ah… crusader. I know the type. It doesn’t leave a lot of time for personal life though, does it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about you? Are you the crusader type as well?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Married to the Bill, I’m afraid. The job comes first. Sometimes I wish it didn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I know the feeling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Look over there by the bar. My 1 o’clock.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Let the games begin.

utterance.speaker: NIGEL WYNDHAM
utterance.content: Good evening. Nigel Wyndham, Deputy General.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jean Harrington, bored.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: Well we’ll have to remedy that, Miss Harrington. Uh, one for the lady, please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, a ring. That’s discouraging.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: Oh, well … needn’t be. To new friendships.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: Now tell me, Miss Harrington. Are you here alone? If so it would be a grave injustice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My date’s more interested in networking than he is in me.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: In that case, he won’t object if I ask you for a dance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? I wouldn’t care even if he did.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: Shall we?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: So Miss Harrington, what should I know about you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, there’s more to me than meets the eye.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: Well, what meets the eye is irresistible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, actions speak louder than words.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: Meaning?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Meaning if I’m so irresistible, then why aren’t you using both your hands?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Excuse me Your Excellency.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Oh, excuse me. Pardon me. Coming through.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Sorry, sir. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: SECURITY MAN BRYSON
utterance.content: Sir Alfred Heath?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: SECURITY MAN BRYSON
utterance.content: May I have a word, sir? There seems to be two of you here this evening.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: I have to ask, are you as aggressive in your other activities as you are on the dance floor?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, you know, what can I say? I like to lead. All the time.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: You – Is everything all right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um… yeah, you know, suddenly I feel very hungry. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would you like one of there? I hear they’re great.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: I’m not a caviar man myself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but I hear they’re an aphrodisiac.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: Mmm… not for me, I’m afraid.

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUY BRYSON
utterance.content: Sorry to intrude, Mr. Wyndham.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: Yes, what is it, Bryson?

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUY BRYSON
utterance.content: The young lady, I need her to come with me.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: Well, for what purpose?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t worry, darling. I have no doubt that we’ll see each other again very soon.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Ugh, I had the waiter then I lost him. I bollixed up the whole plan and now we’ve got nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I wouldn’t say nothing. I swiped Wyndham’s card case. It’s got his prints all over it.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Look at you, you sneaky little thief. That’s bloody brilliant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. Now let’s go get this son of a b*tch.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Print’s not a match.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: CSU ran the fingerprints off the card case, compared them to the print Lanie pulled off of Naomi’s body. It wasn’t a match.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, that’s not possible. Run it again.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan already did that three times. Wyndham’s not our killer.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: He’s behind this, I know it. It’s why Naomi left us his photograph.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well maybe he hired somebody to do his dirty work for him.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Like one of his security men.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you get Scotland Yard to run background checks on the security staff?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or a better path might be to look into this mysterious number that Naomi wrote on the back of that photo. Which is a mystery no longer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is this lobster, bro?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lucky for you, Jacinda’s a light eater. You heat that up, a little bit of melted butter –

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Are you telling me she knew what that number means? How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well as Jacinda and I were enjoying our succulent lobsters – from Maine – paired with an earthy yet elegant Pinot Noir from Sonoma Valley –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. Numbers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Well, we were going over the file. Turns out Jacinda’s quite a little crime solver.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You showed the stewardess the evidence file?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. I took picture of it with my phone. And the current nomenclature is ‘flight attendant’. Point is, this code refers to a diplomatic pouch.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: How do you know that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jacinda recognized the format. Furthermore, she told me these last three digits are a reference code for Royal Eastern Airlines.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which means the pouch was delivered on an airline.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. The W4 refers to the size of the pouch, the 1949 indicates exactly which pouch it is in the consulate sequence.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: As the Deputy General Nigel signs for all the pouches.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then maybe this wasn’t about an affair gone wrong between Nigel and Naomi.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: It’s about smuggling.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that makes a lot of sense. Diplomatic pouches are sealed and their contents bypass TSA and customs inspections.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Naomi must have got on to what Wyndham was doing somehow. We need to know what was in that pouch.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Consulate’s never going to release that information.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well we don’t have to worry about the Consulate. The airline keeps a copy of the waybill.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get a hold of the airline. Let’s get that waybill down here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan. Grab a pen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you can’t just share confidential police information with an outsider.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Even if it solves the case? I mean, she gave us a lead. That’s more than you got at the Consulate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that’s supposed to make this all okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jacinda just wanted to help. What’s the big deal?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You just don’t get it, do you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I guess I don’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. No, I guess you don’t.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. We found something you’re going to want to see.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Airline sent over the waybill. The pouch that matched our number was shipped from the British Consulate about a year ago. It flew from JFK to Kampala, Uganda.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Uganda. That can’t be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Naomi’s boyfriend, the one who died. He was killed in Uganda.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea what was being shipped?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh… just that it weighed 200 pounds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that’s awfully heavy for a pouch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, a diplomatic pouch can be as small as an envelope or as large as a cargo container.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whatever’s being shipped, it’s being sent out about once a month. I just combed through airline waybills from the last year. Ten other pouches, all the same weight, were flown from here to Uganda. In fact, one of them is listed as being in JFK’s secure baggage area.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: You mean to say one of those pouches is at the airport right now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Finding out what’s in that pouch could tell us who killed Naomi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but we don’t have any jurisdiction here, Castle. If the NYPD tries to open up a British diplomatic pouch we could risk an international incident.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Well, then it’s a good thing I’m not NYPD.

utterance.speaker: JFK GUARD MORGAN
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Oh, good evenin’ sir. I’m Agent Bauer, Homeland Security.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: I’m here for the inspection.

utterance.speaker: JFK GUARD MORGAN
utterance.content: Nobody radioed me about any inspection.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Of course they didn’t. We conduct random checks to assess security. Telling you we were coming kind of defeats the purpose, am I right? We’d be tippin’ our hand, showing our playbook, so to speak.

utterance.speaker: JFK GUARD MORGAN
utterance.content: Two years I’ve worked this shift and I’ve never heard of any –

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Look, Morgan, is it? I’m sure you run a tight ship here, so if everything checks out as secure I’ll be sure your bosses know about it, which will reflect well on you. We’re all on the same team here, pal.

utterance.speaker: JFK GUARD MORGAN
utterance.content: I gotta verify this with my supervisor!

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: You do that.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: I’m more adept at faking my way past people. Must be all the practice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re in the baggage area?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Yep. I don’t have much time. Maybe a minute before the guard gets his supervisor to check my story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so based on the shipping code the pouch that you’re looking for is about 5 feet long.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Does the waybill say if it’s a crate, a footlocker, a cardboard box? What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. Sorry bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But its 200 pounds so it’s gotta be something sturdy.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Something sturdy. Right.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Here we go. I found it. It’s a crate.

utterance.speaker: JFK GUARD MORGAN
utterance.content: Agent Bauer? I need you to step out of there, please.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, that didn’t sound good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Agent Bauer? What did he expect?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: I heard that.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Uh… I’m just about wrapped up here.

utterance.speaker: JFK GUARD MORGAN
utterance.content: My supervisor will be here in like –

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: And he will be mighty pleased with your work. Mighty pleased. It’s clear to me you’ve been working harder than a … one legged man at a mouse kicking contest.

utterance.speaker: JFK GUARD MORGAN
utterance.content: Step out of there now, sir. I will not tell you again.

utterance.speaker: JFK GUARD MORGAN
utterance.content: Hello? You there? Hello?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Bloody hell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s in the crate?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Missiles.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Customs and Homeland Security have impounded the crate and Interpol is on their way to JFK.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you explain opening the diplomatic pouch?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Well, everyone’s more interested in the missiles at the moment, but I expect I’ll be hot water at some point.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where does this leave Wyndham?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Untouched.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you mean, untouched? He was smuggling weapons.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Well there’ll be an inquiry of course, but they can’t prove he knew what was in the crate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And since we opened the crate illegally we won’t be able to use it as evidence.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: At least it all starts to make sense now. Naomi was trying to solve Aiden’s murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That would be Naomi’s boyfriend, Aiden Miller. He worked for Doctors Without Borders in Uganda until his helicopter was shot down by guerrilla forces a year ago.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: The British government launched an investigation but was never able to determine how the rebels acquired a stinger missile.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which we now know came to them courtesy of Nigel Wyndham.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except Nigel’s not the type to get his hands dirty when it comes to missiles or murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Must have had a partner who had a line on those stingers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if Naomi started looking into the smuggling operation –

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Then perhaps it was the partner that got rid of her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So then the question is who is his partner?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everything is Naomi did was about finding out who supplied the weapon that killed her boyfriend. That’s why she stopped taking modeling gigs. That’s why she came to New York. Maybe there’s someone on the list of attendees for that foreign dignitary party.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I mean, it all started when she booked that in London a few months ago.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Paulo Macuzzi.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And who is he?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Leader of the rebel army in Uganda.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Naomi must have heard something at the party. That’s what lead her to the Consulate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That romantic dinner with Nigel was just part of her agenda to get the pouch number from his office.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So then there’s just one piece that doesn’t fit in her investigation. What was she doing with Biggie Slim?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I want you to take a close look at this photo.

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: Yeah, I see. That’s when paparazzi caught me and Nicki J coming out of the studio a couple of weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In fact, that is Nicki J’s black SUV, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: Bought by Biggie Slim himself. Supply and demand. She demands, I gotta supply.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, the thing that I find intriguing is that before you became Biggie Slim your name was Darrius Young. Best known for launching several failed internet startups.

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: But a man ahead of my time.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Well the SEC thought you were a man trying to fleece investors.

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: See I was never charged for that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: One of your ventures, a music sharing website based in the UK caught the attention of authorities and when they tried to shut it down and aide to the Minister of Culture lobbied on your behalf. And do you know who that aide was? Nigel Wyndham. In fact, this is Nigel stepping out of the very same black SUV.

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: No … I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t you take a closer look. Those are the same custom pinstripes on the door.

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: It’s just somebody else's truck with those stripes on there.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Your driver already admitted that he drove you to this meeting outside the Consulate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We also know that your cousin is in the service. Drew Harris?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: A staff sergeant. He works at an armory. He supplied the missiles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You knew that Wyndham had access to the diplomatic pouch and you saw an opportunity.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Supply and demand.

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: That’s a whole lot of speculation there, mate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we weren’t the only ones to put together the pieces.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Naomi wasn’t giving you her phone number. She was looking for evidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Once you realized that she was the same girl that Wyndham caught snooping you followed her to the motel and you killed her.

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: Well how’re ya’ll gonna prove that?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: A partial fingerprint on Naomi’s body. And it’s a match to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, the thing that I still can’t figure out is why Uganda? Why would you care?

utterance.speaker: BIGGIE SLIM
utterance.content: Man, it wasn’t about Uganda. It was just about the money. I didn’t even know where Wyndham was shippin’ the stuff to.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: Good. I will call my assistant. I’m wide open all week.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Actually, you’re not. Or the following week for that matter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Told you I’d see you soon.

utterance.speaker: WYNDHAM
utterance.content: What is this? Getting thrown out of here once wasn’t enough for you people? Security –

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: They can’t help you, mate. Nobody can. Not even your well-funded Ugandan friends. Nigel Wyndham, you’re under arrest for international arms trafficking and

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Her dad would have been proud. How brave she was, taking on these men. I still wish she hadn’t done it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do what happens now? Do you go back to DC?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: London, I’m afraid. Face the music.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, they should give you a commendation.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Well, that is wildly improbable.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Well, Detective Beckett. It’s been a true pleasure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The pleasure was all mine, Detective Inspector Hunt.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Please. Colin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kate.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: You know I have a few hours before my flight, Kate. Could I persuade you to let me buy you a drink?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I have a bit of paperwork to do.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Another time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s Scotland Yard off to?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, he’s going back to London. Um… Castle, do you have a second? Can we talk?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, I don’t. Jacinda had the Ferrari double parked in a loading zone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. 4 dates in 3 days. You like her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She just … she doesn’t seem like your type.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, she’s fun and uncomplicated. I think that’s what my life needs right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi. It’s uh … it’s Kate. Do you still want to buy me that drink?

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
